title: 105_s110
content: AMENDMENTS TO THE NATIVE AMERICAN GRAVES PROTECTION AND REPATRIATION ACT. The Native American Graves Protection and Repatriation Act is amended to require written consent for intentional excavation or removal of Native American human remains for study purposes from lineal descendants or appropriate Indian tribes or Native Hawaiian organizations. The Native American Graves Protection and Repatriation Act is amended to require written consent for any recordation or analysis beyond what is already allowed or required under the Act, without the consent of appropriate Indian tribes or Native Hawaiian organizations. The Native American Graves Protection and Repatriation Act now requires notification to appropriate Indian tribes or Native Hawaiian organizations regarding cultural items found on lands under Federal agency management authority within 3 business days of discovery. The Native American Graves Protection and Repatriation Act now requires notification to appropriate Indian tribes or Native Hawaiian organizations regarding cultural items found on lands under Federal agency management authority within 3 business days of discovery. Amendments include compliance requirements for disposing of cultural items and associated funerary objects. The Native American Graves Protection and Repatriation Act is amended to include enforcement provisions for penalties collected, which will supplement appropriations for enforcement activities related to the Act. The Secretary is authorized to pay individuals providing information leading to civil penalties under the Act. The Native American Graves Protection and Repatriation Act is amended to include enforcement provisions for penalties collected, allowing for the reduction of civil penalties by half or $1,000 if the violator agrees to pay restitution to aggrieved parties.
